meanings.definition: The rank or title of a peer
meanings.sent1: In the past, only a few individuals could hold peerages.
meanings.sent2: The peerages were bestowed upon those who had shown great loyalty to the king.
meanings.sent3: The competition for peerages was fierce among the nobles.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness and generosity elevated her to the peerages of society.
meanings.sent5: The peerages symbolized the highest level of honor and respect.

meanings.definition: The collective body of peers or nobles in a country
meanings.sent1: The peerages gathered to discuss matters of great importance.
meanings.sent2: The history books often mention the peerages of ancient kingdoms.
meanings.sent3: At the royal banquet, the peerages engaged in a lively debate.
meanings.sent4: The peerages stood united in times of crisis, showing their strength.
meanings.sent5: The grand hall was filled with the elegance and power of the peerages.
